Title: Commercial Strategy Associate - Experienced Graduates (Spring 2025 Starts)
RoleDescription:
*This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Who We Are:
Wayfairs Commercial organization delivers on Wayfairs promise to help everyone anywhere create their feeling of home through building an unparalleled selection, driving tangible value, and ensuring a seamless customer experience. This team builds strong relationships with suppliers to provide true partnership in helping customers create a space that reflects who they are and what they need. They attract, grow, and retain Wayfairs customer base through innovative marketing strategies. This team curates and refines product collections to enhance and optimize the shopping journey. As an Associate, youll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantages for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the end-to-end supplier and customer experience.
What Youll Do:

Analyze data and trends to improve the quality of our product catalog in order to increase customer satisfaction, trust, and site conversion rates; researching categories and vendors to build out selection
Create cross-functional partnerships to advance your category and suppliers through merchandising, promotions, marketing, on-trend product selection, effective pricing and profitability, and operational excellence
Create and enforce best practice guidelines to enrich product assortment, optimizing processes to enable high quality & efficiency while guaranteeing an easily digestible experience for suppliers & internal stakeholders
Build key supplier relationships to enable successful negotiations and push towards a best-in-class customer experience
Leverage data to analyze the competitive environment, report on performance trends, and develop business cases for strategic initiatives
Represent Wayfair at various offsite events such as trade shows
Manage communication with internal and external stakeholders

What Youll Need:
Basic Qualifications:

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future

Preferred Qualifications:

Analytical mindset able to process large volumes of data using a variety of reporting tools (Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, etc.)
Ability to distill complex information in a simplistic way via emails, charts, graphs, and other forms of presentations
Passionate about execution with a strong interest to drive customer engagement
Desire to own projects from beginning to end, and thrive as part of a team as well as individually
Comfortable navigating a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong project management and prioritization skills

As a Commercial Strategy Associate, youll join our teams that are driving Wayfairs best-in-class online customer experience. Youll be responsible for owning and maintaining Wayfairs vast e-commerce catalog, executing strategy for product categories and managing supplier relationships, and continually improving the customers on-site shopping experience. 
Possible Team Placements Include:
B2B
Wayfair Professional (aka Wayfair B2B) is an industry leading business to business sales organization dedicated to help businesses make good spaces great. Wayfair Professional is the gated experience of Wayfair dedicated to all business customers. We organize our customer base and corresponding offering (site and sales) into 7 industry verticals, prioritizing our Interior Design, Commercial Office and Contractor experiences. We are on a journey to being a $5B+ business by 2025 (+30% YoY growth), with over a $300B opportunity to cover across North America and Europe over the subsequent 10 years.
Catalog Health
In this role, you will own offshore operations, manage inbound requests, and oversee the supplier and product delisting process, ensuring a healthy and trustworthy catalog that abides by our Code of Conduct. You will work cross-functionally with Business and Technology teams to improve operational workflows, identify opportunities for efficiency, and inform key business strategies. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, is a problem-solver with strong communication skills, and enjoys collaborating with multiple stakeholders to drive impactful results. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in e-commerce operations, working closely with cross-functional teams to improve catalog health and drive efficiency at scale. If you are a proactive problem-solver with a passion for operational excellence, wed love to hear from you!
Catalog Merchandising
The Global Merchandising organization is responsible for building and maintaining Wayfairs e-commerce catalog of over 24 million+ products. The organization consists of multiple teams who each play a crucial role in defining and executing on best-in-class merchandising. The Global Merchandising teams guide the management of our enormous product catalog and provide suppliers with tools to continually expand our product assortment. The Merch teams drive product discovery, consideration, and purchase on all of our stores and marketing channels by ensuring customers have complete, accurate, and relevant product information, and by removing friction for suppliers to provide it. The Data Integrations & Analytics teams leverage Big Data to optimize internal merchandising processes. Together, these teams deliver on key merchandising goals. 
Category Management
The Category Management team drives strategy for Wayfairs product categories through tight internal and external partnership. We serve as ambassadors of the product categories we manage. We are at the forefront as Wayfair redefines the supplier experience as a platform, giving suppliers more data, more transparency, and more control while retaining the high-touch elements that make working with Wayfair exceptional. Internally, we leverage a diverse set of cross-functional partners to execute our strategic vision. In a role on the Category Management team, you will be expected to define overarching goals and strategy within your category, problem-solve, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and manage key business metrics. Members of the team must be able to expertly negotiate internally and externally, while also being effective project managers.
Merchandising Compliance
Our Merchandising Compliance team is responsible for keeping our customers safe, and our products, services and offerings in compliance with applicable federal or local regulations. We support those efforts through building efficient processes and scalable technology solutions. If youre passionate about driving business impact by working cross functionally, love working through complex operations decisions, and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.
North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics 
The North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics Team empowers stakeholders across the Global Supplier Organization, enabling teams to grow their businesses. As an associate you would help streamline processes, organize internal and external communication with regard to program updates, new tools, etc, and work closely with data to draw conclusions and influence stakeholders.
Perigold 
Perigold is Wayfairs newest brand, targeting the luxury home market. We are focused on providing an unparalleled assortment of luxury home goods through an elevated online shopping experience for our customers. We do this by connecting the best brands with our luxury customers while working on product curation, brand marketing and storytelling, building a best-in-class site experience, and providing best-in-class service and delivery. We serve as ambassadors for the categories we manage by identifying and solving unique customer and supplier challenges. Internally, we partner with various teams including Profit Management, Merchandising, Partner Operations, Marketing, Brand and Curated Merchandising and Promotions to bring the Perigold vision to life.
Supplier Advertising & Merch Services
The Supplier Advertising team sells and advocates the use of our advertising suite of products to our supplier base. We help suppliers stand out on site and amplify their exposure off site. The team is focused on driving: the maximum performance for every dollar a supplier spends with us and significant high margin revenue to Wayfairs bottom line.
Supplier Inventory Management
On the Supplier Inventory Management team, we partner with thousands of suppliers to maximize customers experience. This means driving speed and availability through supplier inventory and positioning strategies, leveraging both Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) as well as suppliers existing supply chains. On this team, you'll have a "COO" mindset, and be responsible for individual supplier and category inventory strategy, including integrating with Wayfair's e-comm and physical retail.

Title: Senior Analyst, Partner Feedback
RoleDescription:
The Partner Feedback team is seeking a highly analytical and driven professional to enhance Wayfairs supplier, customer, and carrier experience through data-driven insights. This role focuses on extracting actionable intelligence from satisfaction surveys, Net Promoter Score (NPS) surveys, and ad hoc feedback initiatives to directly shape operational and product strategies. By leveraging Google BigQuery (GBQ), Looker, and survey tools like Typeform, this role will drive impactful improvements across Wayfairs ecosystem.
This is a high-visibility role where feedback fuels data-backed decision-making. Youll be responsible for designing feedback mechanisms, optimizing survey distribution strategies, building dynamic dashboards, and delivering key insights to senior leadership. You will have the opportunity to lead the way, leveraging AI functionality to gain improved insight from the feedback partners share. Working across Global Partner Support (GPS), Product, and Commercial teams, youll ensure that real-time partner sentiment and analytics translate into tangible enhancements in Wayfairs processes and technology stack.
What Youll Do

Analyze structured and unstructured feedback data using Google BigQuery (GBQ) and build advanced Looker dashboards to visualize trends in partner sentiment.
Build dashboards, visualizations and prototypes to translate data sets into driving insights and actions
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build advanced reports
Utilize AI functionality to detect trends in feedback and pilot multiple use cases across different ML models. 
Identify key drivers of satisfaction and pain points, delivering data-backed recommendations to Product, GPS, and Commercial teams to drive continuous improvement.
Develop sustainable, long-term performance management practices to assess and grow the business
Develop real-time KPI tracking mechanisms, ensuring leadership has visibility into partner experience trends and performance metrics.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, GPS, and Operations, to integrate feedback insights into process automation, AI-driven support tools, and strategic initiatives.
Manage centralized data repositories for partner feedback, ensuring streamlined reporting and accessibility for decision-makers.
Engage in road mapping and prioritization through diligent opportunity sizing and scoping efforts

 
What Youll Bring

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
2+ years of experience in data analytics, partner/customer insights, or related fields.
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for across business and technical teams.
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change
Familiarity with Jira (SupportHub) and experience working with feedback integration into operational workflows is a plus.

Why Join Us?
This role offers the opportunity to work at the intersection of data science, partner experience, and AI-driven automation, ensuring that partner insights drive tangible business impact. Youll work with cutting-edge analytics tools, contribute to high-impact initiatives, and influence strategic decisions that shape Wayfairs global supplier and customer support experience.

Title: Financial Analyst - Experienced Graduates (Spring 2025 Starts)
RoleDescription:
Finance Analysts - Experienced Graduates
Spring 2025 start
Location: Boston, MA
 
This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation.
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Who we are:
Do you like distilling complex problems into actionable solutions? Are you able to quantify costs, understand their business impact, and communicate the tradeoffs? Do you want to use data to identify key opportunities and drive multi-million dollar investment decisions for Wayfairs various business segments?  The Strategic Finance team owns all forecasting and financial reporting for our growing global business and acts as a strategic partner to each of our business units to ensure we are supporting Wayfairs growth while also making sound financial decisions for the business.  We are a diverse and fun crew - come join us!
Possible Team Placements Include:
Analyst, Brand Finance
With Wayfairs aggressive growth comes the need for strong financial partnership, planning, and support across the business. The Brand Finance team works closely with brand General Managers and cross-functional stakeholders (Marketing, Profit Management, Operations) across all of Wayfairs brands and sub-entities to translate business initiatives and strategies into expected financial outcomes, plan for future growth and profitability goals, and act as a check and balance for business partner initiatives. In addition to forecasting revenue, Brand Finance leads brand-level P&L creation & analyses, investment modeling, scenario planning, and profitability planning across Wayfairs businesses.
The Brand Finance team consists of analytical and detail-oriented individuals who enable leadership to make strategic business decisions by providing analysis of business performance and delivering in-depth business forecasting models. We enjoy tackling challenging problems and translating quantitative analyses into business insights and actionable strategies. This is a highly visible role within Wayfair and ideal for someone who wants to work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and data-driven environment. 
CastleGate Forwarding (CGF) - Billing & Audit
The position available at this time is specifically on the CastleGate Forwarding (CGF) - Billing & Audit team. CGF Billing & Audit manages the billing operations for Wayfair's Castlegate Forwarding business, as well as assisting with billing disputes and auditing Wayfair data to ensure billing accuracy and compliance.This position helps enable new CastleGate Forwarding business lines and services, by building and utilizing new data monitors to proactively identify and mitigate risk to invoicing. Gathering and analyzing data on billing disputes to gain insights on how to improve moving forward is also a critical component of the role.
What You'll Do

Drive Brand Finance forecasting workstreams for some of Wayfairs highest growth websites and brands both domestically and internationally.
Drive thought leadership; supported by data-driven insights, youll help leadership inform strategic, financial, and operational decision-making across the company. Your scope will span long-term business strategy and planning to short term orders forecasts.
Strengthen existing relationships with cross-functional partners across Operations, Marketing, and Profit Management, serving as the subject matter expert on Revenue and Ad Spend for your brands.
Working with large data sets to identify data issues before they impact invoices
Engaging with CGF stakeholders to resolve data issues
Working with Wayfair accounting to ensure all CGF financial data is accurately accounted for
Engaging with supplier relationship managers and suppliers to resolve billing dispute

 
What Youll Need 
Basic Qualifications:

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience
Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

Proficiency in working with large and/or complex data to drive actionable insights in at least 1 of the following (a) Excel or Google Sheets and (b) SQL, GBQ, or an equivalent
Ability to work in an environment that requires being a self starter and team player
Ability to simplify complex data, identify core themes, root causes and provide actionable solutions (e.g., critical thinking & problem solving skills)
Interest in joining a lean team who takes pride in ensuring deadlines are consistently met and there is a one team mentality to get the job done
Detail oriented and enjoys tackling new challenges

Title: Senior Data Engineer, CG Performance Forecasting
RoleDescription:
Must be ONSITE in Boston, MA (Monday - Thursday)
Wayfairs Forecasting & Replenishment Analytics team is looking for a Data Scientist/Engineer to create advanced analytical tools and modeling solutions that will help us predict inventory coverage and penetration in CastleGate across various granularities as well as create insights to understand the capability gaps in the program. In this team, you will grow your technical skills, build and eventually own products that are leveraged by cross-functional teams at Wayfair. builds algorithmic solutions to enhance the customer experience, the supplier experience, and internal operational efficiencies that ultimately drive our bottom line. The team consists of technical analysts, data science/ML/economics experts, ML/software engineers and product managers who are responsible for developing and managing global large-scale forecasting and replenishment systems that power Wayfairs complex supply chain. 
The Data Scientist/Engineer for the CG Performance Forecasting team will drive continuous improvement of this space by creating advanced analytical tools and modeling solutions that will help us predict inventory coverage and penetration in CastleGate and work with cross-functional stakeholders for adoption. The Technical Analyst will become an expert in the CG Performance Forecasting space and will engage with Technology, Operations, and Finance partners to ensure we have a unified signal that accurately reflects the future of the business and can be leveraged by these teams. Within this broader team, the CG Performance Forecasting team measures, monitors and predicts performance metrics relevant to Wayfairs CastleGate program which serve as key inputs for the Commercial/Operations organizations and continuously enhance the CastleGate value proposition for our suppliers and customers. 
What Youll Do: 

Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines to ensure seamless data flow from various sources to storage and analytics systems
Work with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to clean and structure raw data for usability
Set up and maintain scalable, secure, and high-performance databases, data lakes, or warehouses
Develop and maintain self-service analytics in Looker, designing intuitive LookML models, dashboards, and data exploration tools for business users
Extract, model, and analyze data from complex sources (operations, logistics, product, and customer databases) to deliver business insights and recommendations
Serve as the subject matter expert for data, analytics, and testing in specific business domains, ensuring accurate interpretation of core metrics and consumer behavior.
Develop predictive modeling solutions to generate forward-looking performance projections, improving operational forecasts and aiding labor and capacity planning
Perform statistical analysis on large datasets to identify performance trends and enhance operational efficiency
Create key metrics and analytical tools to monitor performance, identify trends, and develop targeted action plans in Wayfairs CastleGate program
Build efficient, reusable data structures adaptable to a dynamic environment
Partner with Inventory Management, Network Management, and Ops Forecasting teams to drive adoption of insights and enhance CastleGate program value for suppliers and customers 
Collaborate across commercial, operations, and technology teams to align Data Science-driven strategies with Wayfairs business objectives

What You'll Need 

Masters or Bachelors degree in a quantitative field (computer science preferred)
2+ years of professional experience
Professional experience in writing code in structured programming languages (Python, R), writing scripts using GBQ or SQL, creating Pivot Tables and Vlookups in Google Sheets or Excel, and using data visualization tools such as Data Studio, Looker, Tableau or PowerBI
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change

Title: Project Manager - Physical Retail Installations
RoleDescription:
This is a full-time, salaried role based in Boston. Employees are expected to work in-office Monday - Thursday, Friday is optional WFH. 
 
Wayfair is seeking a dynamic and organized Installations Manager to join our growing Physical Retail team. This role is crucial in ensuring the seamless and efficient execution of all in-store and Retail Lab installations, directly impacting the visual presentation and customer experience of our physical spaces. The ideal candidate will possess a blend of project management acumen and a strong understanding of in-store visual merchandising principles.
Responsibilities:
Project Management:


Develop and manage comprehensive project plans from conception to completion for all in-store installations, including visual merchandising displays, fixtures, and mock store builds.
Establish clear timelines, milestones, and deliverables for each project, ensuring on-time and within-budget execution.
Proactively identify and mitigate potential project risks and roadblocks.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including schedules, budgets, and vendor communications.


Vendor Management:


Source, vet, and manage relationships with third-party vendors, including installers, contractors, and other service providers.
Negotiate contracts and ensure vendor compliance with project specifications and quality standards.
Schedule and coordinate vendor activities to align with project timelines.
Book travel for vendors, and yourself as needed.


Visual Merchandising Expertise:


Collaborate with the Visual Merchandising team to translate design concepts into actionable installation plans.
Ensure that all installations adhere to brand standards and visual merchandising guidelines.
Provide on-site support and guidance if needed during installations, ensuring accurate execution and addressing any issues that may arise.


Process Development & Scalability:


Develop and implement standardized processes and procedures for in-store installations to ensure consistency and efficiency across all locations.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization to support the scalability of Wayfair's physical retail footprint.
Create and maintain a central database for all installation information, including vendor contacts, installation guides, and project documentation.


Store Accountability & Communication:


Establish clear lines of communication with store teams, providing regular updates on project progress and addressing any concerns.
Hold store teams accountable for the proper maintenance and upkeep of installed displays and fixtures, even when not onsite.
Conduct post-installation reviews to evaluate project success and identify areas for improvement.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:


Work closely with the Builds team, Visual Merchandising team, and other cross-functional partners to ensure seamless project execution.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, proactively providing regular updates and addressing any questions or concerns.


Qualifications:

Proven experience in in-store visual merchandising.
Project management experience is preferred, but not required.
Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.  
Familiar with simple vinyl installations.
Ability to read and interpret construction documents and visual merchandising plans.  
Ability to travel as needed to support store installations.
Ability to create and maintain budgets.
Ability to create and maintain project timelines.
A proactive, problem-solving attitude with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
Ability to create scalable processes.
Physical ability to lift up to 25 lbs., hang frames/artwork, and work on 8-12-ft. ladders as needed.
20-30% travel required for store visits and new store openings.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience managing third-party vendors and contractors.
Experience with retail construction or build-outs.
Experience with reading and understanding blue prints.
Familiarity with Sketch-Up or similar software.
Familiarity with Google Workspace.

Title: Manager, Financial Planning and Analysis
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
About Financial Planning and Analysis at Wayfair: With Wayfairs focus on profitable operations comes the need for strong financial partnership, planning, and support across the business. The Financial Planning and Analysis team works collaboratively with various teams across the business to drive fiscal accountability, provide visibility into actual performance and shape our forecast based on most current trends and business insights. Our work provides the business with financial insights that directly impact the direction of Wayfair's business. We enjoy tackling challenging problems and translating quantitative analyses into strategic business implications.

Wayfair is looking for a financial leader to manage our OPEX spend planning and reporting processes (including compensation and third party spend). The individual will lead a team of three to four analysts. Partner with senior stakeholders to drive monthly planning, reporting and analyses of spent vs targets. 
Coordinate the global quarterly forecasting process for OPEX spend.
Lead month-end and quarter-end close forecast to actuals variance analysis and review.
Drive delivery of and improvement in all internal management reporting through automation and AI, reporting visualization and enabling of self-serve stakeholder capabilities.
Attract, develop and retain a high-performing finance team.

What Youll Need:

Bachelor's degree required (in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Accounting Information Systems or related field preferred).
5+ years of experience in corporate finance, talent analytics, or similar analytics roles.
Proven cross-functional partnership skills with diverse set of senior leadership.
Exceptional analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
Proven ability to model and forecast with accuracy.
Experience / familiarity with any of SQL, Looker, Workday, Coupa or similar procurement and Human Capital Management systems; Excel / Gsheet advanced modeling skills.
Demonstrated experience leading and developing a team.
Superb attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and deliver in a fast-paced environment.

Were seeking highly analytical, passionate, and self-motivated individuals to join our North American Retail Buying and Category Management team. North American Retail is the organization within Wayfair that drives the overall strategy for the multitude of product categories that are offered across our channels of business. The team serves as the external and internal ambassadors of the product categories we manage, mobilizing and coaching suppliers on how to grow their business on our sites, and leveraging internal partners to execute the strategic vision to win in the online home space.
Who We Are
The Category Management team offers a unique opportunity to drive strategy for Wayfairs largest product categories through tight internal and external partnership. We serve as ambassadors of the product categories we manage. We are at the forefront as Wayfair redefines the supplier experience as a platform, giving suppliers more data, more transparency, and more control while retaining the high-touch elements that make working with Wayfair exceptional. Identify sales, merchandising, and operational opportunities for the category and collaborate with internal teams to drive change (Planning, Advertising, Merchandising, Operations, PR, Finance, Customer Service, Business Intelligence)

Attend tradeshows to visit key suppliers (4-8 times per year)

Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal


A track record of successful negotiation and relationship management skills


An ability to hit the ground running  a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter


Demonstrated senior presence, recognized as an effective manager

Title: ML Scientist, Advertising Optimization & Automation
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we areWayfairs Advertising business is rapidly expanding, adding hundreds of millions of dollars in profits to Wayfair. We are building Sponsored Products, Display & Video Ad offerings that cater to a variety of Advertiser goals while showing highly relevant and engaging Ads to millions of customers. We are evolving our Ads Platform to empower advertisers across all sophistication levels to grow their business on Wayfair at a strong, positive ROI and are leveraging state of the art Machine Learning techniques.
The Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team is central to this effort. We leverage machine learning and generative AI to streamline campaign workflows, delivering impactful recommendations on budget allocation, target Return on Ad Spend (tROAS), and SKU selection. Additionally, we are developing intelligent systems for creative optimization and exploring agentic frameworks to further simplify and enhance advertiser interactions.
We are looking for Machine Learning Scientists to join the Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team. In this role, you will be responsible for the development of budget, tROAS and SKU recommendations and other machine learning capabilities supporting our ads business. You will work closely with other scientists, as well as members of our internal Product and Engineering teams, to apply your engineering and machine learning skills to solve some of our most impactful and intellectually challenging problems to directly impact Wayfairs revenue.

Design, build, deploy and refine large-scale machine learning models and algorithmic decision-making systems that solve real-world problems for customers
Work cross-functionally with commercial stakeholders to understand business problems or opportunities and develop appropriately scoped analytical solutions
Collaborate closely with various engineering, infrastructure, and machine learning platform teams to ensure adoption of best-practices in how we build and deploy scalable machine learning services
Identify new opportunities and insights from the data (where can the models be improved? What is the projected ROI of a proposed modification?)
Be obsessed with the customer and maintain a customer-centric lens in how we frame, approach, and ultimately solve every problem we work on.

3+ years of industry experience with a Bachelor/ Masters degree or minimum of 1-2 years of industry experience with PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
Proficiency in Python or one other high-level programming language
Solid hands-on expertise deploying machine learning solutions into production
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and machine learning algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiastic about continuous learning

Nice to have

Experience with Python machine learning ecosystem (numpy, pandas, sklearn, XGBoost, etc.) and/or Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML)
Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), machine learning model development frameworks, machine learning orchestration tools (Airflow, Kubeflow or MLFlow)
Experience in information retrieval, query/intent understanding, search ranking, recommender systems etc.
Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Advertising Ranking & Optimization
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 15 million items across home furnishings, decor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Suppliers are crucial partners in enabling Wayfairs mission. Within Global Supplier Technology (GST), the Supplier Advertising team owns the strategy and development of Wayfairs Supplier Advertising offerings which help suppliers boost visibility of their products and brands on our platform. This high-margin business is one of the biggest opportunities in Wayfairs profitability. 
Millions of customers visit Wayfair. Each time a customer clicks on a page, we strive to show relevant, personalized ads that are going to generate positive return on investment for our supplier advertisers. We achieve this through a combination of relevance models, a real-time auction, and exposing certain controls to advertisers. Achieving optimal auction outcomes is a complex problem requiring trade-offs across several goals. 
As the leader for our Ranking & Optimization team, you will be responsible for maximizing auction outcomes across advertisers and/or customers across millions of auctions every day globally. Achieving this will require creating the right long-term incentives and making complex trade-offs across the system. Ensuring that each ad auction is delivering a positive customer and advertiser experience is critical to the growth and long-term sustainability of the Supplier Advertising program at Wayfair.  
If you are interested in leading an empowered team and solving high-impact problems through a combination of research, applied science, and machine learning, come join us and help Wayfair through our next phase of growth.
What You'll Do

Partner with businesses, machine learning / applied science, and other technology teams to identify opportunities to improve outcomes (conversions, ad revenue, advertiser value) of advertising auctions. 
Define the vision for machine learning applications that will help suppliers efficiently manage their advertising campaigns, such as automated bidding. 
Formulate data-based hypotheses, develop scoring and ranking models, and drive recommendations that address unintended outcomes in the advertising auction or that limit advertiser outcomes.
Define product requirements in collaboration with cross-functional and cross-department teams including supplier experience, ad serving, profitability, and pricing algo teams.
Build long-term (12+mo) roadmap and OKRs for the domain and associated business cases that maintain a critical eye for impact and return on investment across complex, multi-cycle investment areas. 
Partner with the engineering team to drive timely and smooth project execution by performing sprint rituals like grooming, planning and retrospective.
Drive go to market for your products in partnership with sales and account management teams to identify areas of opportunity to grow adoption and impact.
Influence the evolution of Wayfair's strategy for advertising offerings. 

Were A Match Because You Have:

5+ years experience in software product development, with a focus on data-driven products. 
Bachelors degree or higher in Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Economics, Analytics, Business Administration, Operations Research, or a directly related field
Experience with leading highly technical and ML-enabled products. 
Experience within digital advertising or recommendation systems is preferred. 
Track record of effective partnership with engineering and machine learning / applied science to drive large, cross-org initiatives. 
Excellent quantitative skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights and requirements. 
Ability to keep up in highly technical conversations.
Ability to think and act both tactically and strategically. 
Ability to work with and influence senior leaders (Director+) across various functional areas.

Title: Manager of wayfair.co.uk Business Trends
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

4+ years of work experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Title: Labor Planning Manager
RoleDescription:
The role plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
